intro: Leucocyclus formosus subsp. amanicus, commonly known as the Taiwan leucocyclus, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as mountain forests, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive silvery-white underside, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
